item.title: Raw
item.description: Its an anti war protest song, so be warned. I wrote this after hearing about the 22aug 2008 killing of 60 children in a coalition airstrike in afghanistan.
item.dc:creator: confushian
item.itunes:summary: Its an anti war protest song, so be warned. I wrote this after hearing about the 22aug 2008 killing of 60 children in a coalition airstrike in afghanistan.

item.title: turkish delight
item.description: our holidays set to music, the croaking noise you hear during the cave section, are frogs, but they were in the park not the caves. we visited the ancient roman town of side in the photo, aspendos, an amphitheatre and went to Dim Cay caves.
item.dc:creator: confushian
item.itunes:summary: our holidays set to music, the croaking noise you hear during the cave section, are frogs, but they were in the park not the caves. we visited the ancient roman town of side in the photo, aspendos, an amphitheatre and went to Dim Cay caves.

item.title: full of it
item.description: confushians official response to the goverments latest assault on logic featuring the famous fuzzbox blues harp and a trampoline for that extra bounce. Special mention to our first feedback from leslie, we had to look up the word bathos in the dictionary, heres my space www.myspace.com/fraserdrummond
item.dc:creator: confushian

item.description: a caribbean flavour this week, starting with an instrummental number, and ending with a live version of "Brother can you help me" featuring Djembe, and not forgeting groucho marx http://www.groucho-marx.com

item.title: impossible confushian
item.description: Citizen confushian gets behind the camera to shoot a video for homies "Impossible songs", filmed in my house, and the best of scottish humour, enjoy. impossible songs http://impossiblesongs.blogspot.com/ the big man http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3jfzbGTvEl8 ricky fulton http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbAikjaiiHY news for neds http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h0qjTdn9W9U

item.title: revolutionary confushian
item.description: this week, its revolution in latin america, featuring the zapatistas of mexico, some real life footage which i think matches the song, ( a grateful dead inspired number) which i have called guatemala, as i once stayed their for a couple of months. the links include, Gil Scott Heron and "the revolution will not be televised", and Mercedes Sosa, singing "gracias a la vida" heron http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uTCQSk2l8bc Mercedes http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WyOJ-A5iv5I

item.title: rock and roll
item.description: this weeks rock and roll video is the rocking blues number "strange how", complete with harmonica played through a fuzzbox ( im not buying a bullfrog mic for one song). Its also my only outing on heavy rock guitar. archery gone mad http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kLSXS4cRFFI domino theory http://vids.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=vids.individual&videoid=1178684965
item.dc:creator: confushian

item.title: shoreline
item.description: this weeks offering is a short video to go with my song "shoreline", filmed on the firth of forth, edinburgh, and features Granton harbour which is quite a feat of stonework. Links this week are a very emotional piece of animation called kiwi, it brought a tear to my eye so i thought i would include it. Also, a vid showing the talents of an urban pursuit known as freewalking. kiwi http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0h_ifrP1WaE freewalking http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8kdgfyX8PAI
item.dc:creator: confushian

item.title: hitchikers guide
item.description: As well as usual couple of tracks, we remember Douglas Adams of hitchiking fame, linkswise, an amazing site full of all sorts, including extensive archives of the grateful dead called desktop download, and footage of the original performance of the harry lime theme tune from the third man. desktop http://desktopdownload.org third man http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gFz79SBnuk8

item.title: buddhist confushian
item.description: a buddhist theme this week, so its thoughtful poetry and rythmn, a look at chanting, ranting etc, leonard cohen narrates tibetan book of the dead http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i9FxdTMJpIs amazing vietnamese dancing http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BTKJiP_bdbE more buddhism http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MCmIq4Ln3Ag

item.title: mellow rootsie abinthe
item.description: this weeks its pretty mellow, "Sun is on its way" is perhaps influenced by the Palm wine music of the carribean, "hooded man" is banjo and mandola in an old time number, with the latin "Absinthe" to finish. Links wise we got Tommy Emmanuel on guitar, and a couple of crackers, with some awesome editing, happy new year http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fW-H0rq-FYM http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JzqumbhfxRo http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jFoyIcuhqos

item.title: christmas confushian
item.description: this week, Confushian brings you a couple of tracks, and some cool links, including the great John cooper clark, the seminal Beazely Street, which influenced todays first track, and a duet with hannah o'reilly entitled roman holiday Beazely Street http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XZymVWuMKVk Where the hell is Matt http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pkh5opBp6K4 Alien plants http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mLk1qDPqx1g

item.title: rose without a sting
item.description: banjo and bouzouki come together in a summer, garden setting, and to the amusement of the locals
item.dc:creator: confushian
item.itunes:summary: banjo and bouzouki come together in a summer, garden setting, and to the amusement of the locals

item.title: acoustic confushian
item.description: After the rapturous applause for the techno podcast, this weeks broadcast is strictly acoustic, and i manage to play some tracks by the local talent. First up, (after a track by me entitled "Rosa doloraosa") is Ross Galloway from Fru$hane, with what i consider one of his best, the excellent "Hearts in my home", and to finish, the epic "Alive" from Chris Brown. Please forgive the inaccurate punctuation.
item.dc:creator: confushian
item.itunes:summary: After the rapturous applause for the techno podcast, this weeks broadcast is strictly acoustic, and i manage to play some tracks by the local talent. First up, (after a track by me entitled "Rosa doloraosa") is Ross Galloway from Fru$hane, with what i consider one of his best, the excellent "Hearts in my home", and to finish, the epic "Alive" from Chris Brown. Please forgive the inaccurate punctuation.

item.title: technological confushian
item.description: this week, confushian gets hold of some software, and mashes up some wicked beats with fruity loops, before pressing the delete button and getting the ukelele out to show the kids what real music sounds like, all sounds by confushian, (even the loud banging ones). The photo is a reference to the white heat of technology, made famous by turntablist MC Harold Wilson who suprisingly moonlighted as British PM.
item.dc:creator: confushian
item.itunes:summary: this week, confushian gets hold of some software, and mashes up some wicked beats with fruity loops, before pressing the delete button and getting the ukelele out to show the kids what real music sounds like, all sounds by confushian, (even the loud banging ones). The photo is a reference to the white heat of technology, made famous by turntablist MC Harold Wilson who suprisingly moonlighted as British PM.

item.title: environmental confushian
item.description: join confushians campaign to save the motorway, find out how we get on here. this weeks songs are, waterfall, merrygoround and African eve, all mellow jazz tinged numbers
item.dc:creator: confushian
item.itunes:summary: join confushians campaign to save the motorway, find out how we get on here. this weeks songs are, waterfall, merrygoround and African eve, all mellow jazz tinged numbers

item.title: multilateral confushian
item.description: this weeks podcast gives you another three tracks from confushian. "Have a drink" is played on mandola, "Assets" is a rocky number, and to finish , the tongue in cheek "butane". As always, a dose of irreverent humour thrown in.
item.dc:creator: confushian
item.itunes:summary: this weeks podcast gives you another three tracks from confushian. "Have a drink" is played on mandola, "Assets" is a rocky number, and to finish , the tongue in cheek "butane". As always, a dose of irreverent humour thrown in.
